channel.title: CVE Feed for ServiceNow -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ServiceNow -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-1209|2023-05-23T16:41:39.227Z -- servicenow -- servicenow%20records
item.description: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities exist in ServiceNow records allowing an authenticated attacker to inject arbitrary scripts.

item.title: CVE-2023-1298|2023-07-07T17:13:15.119Z -- servicenow -- now%20user%20experience
item.description: ServiceNow has released upgrades and patches that address a Reflected Cross-Site scripting (XSS) vulnerability that was identified in the ServiceNow Polaris Layout. This vulnerability would enable an authenticated user to inject arbitrary scripts.

item.title: CVE-2023-3442|2023-07-26T18:32:19.787Z -- servicenow -- jenkins%20plug-in%20for%20servicenow%20devops
item.description: A missing authorization vulnerability exists in versions of the Jenkins Plug-in for ServiceNow DevOps prior to 1.38.1 that, if exploited successfully, could cause the unwanted exposure of sensitive information. To address this issue, apply the 1.38.1 version of the Jenkins plug-in for ServiceNow DevOps on your Jenkins server. No changes are required on your instances of the Now Platform.

item.title: CVE-2023-3414|2023-07-26T18:20:18.253Z -- servicenow -- jenkins%20plug-in%20for%20servicenow%20devops
item.description: A cross-site request forgery vulnerability exists in versions of the Jenkins Plug-in for ServiceNow DevOps prior to 1.38.1 that, if exploited successfully, could cause the unwanted exposure of sensitive information. To address this issue, apply the 1.38.1 version of the Jenkins plug-in for ServiceNow DevOps on your Jenkins server. No changes are required on your instances of the Now Platform.
